definition: to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw
to rest/to stop doing sth for a period of time/to cease/(imperative) don't
see 養老金雙軌制|养老金双轨制[yang3 lao3 jin1 shuang1 gui3 zhi4]
pinyin: tui4 xiu1 jin1 shuang1 gui3 zhi4

sentences.english: Many teachers are waiting for new replacements before retiring.
sentences.chinese: 许多教师正在等候新进人员，以便退休。

sentences.english: What is your reflection upon Samuel's retirement speech?
sentences.chinese: 你对撒母耳的退休演讲有何感想？

sentences.english: The physician has gone into semiretirement because of ill health.
sentences.chinese: 这位医生由于健康不佳已经处于半退休状态了。

sentences.english: We're having a whip-round for old Fred , who's leaving the firm.
sentences.chinese: 我们正在为即将从公司退休的老弗雷德进行募捐。
退休费问题是特别棘手的。

sentences.english: We make the retired official our head of the club.
sentences.chinese: 我们选退休的那位干部来当俱乐部的主任。

sentences.english: Wan replaces the outgoing science minister, Xu Guanhua, who is retiring.
sentences.chinese: 万钢的前任徐冠华部长已经到了退休年龄。

sentences.english: James continued with her day job until she retired.
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯继续白天的工作，直到她退休。

sentences.english: After a series of losses, Braddock is forced into retirement.
sentences.chinese: 在一系列损失之后，布拉多克被迫退休。

sentences.english: Retirement accounts and savings, they say, have been drained to pay legal fees.
sentences.chinese: 用来支付诉讼费用的退休金账户和储蓄已被耗尽。

sentences.english: Slide 7: Save for retirement starting with your first pay check.
sentences.chinese: 退休存款从你的第一张工资条开始。

sentences.english: President John Kufuor is retiring after eight years in office.
sentences.chinese: 加纳总统库福尔在执政8年后将退休。

sentences.english: It's been worth every minute of it. Now I can retire in peace.
sentences.chinese: 每一分钟都是值得的，我现在可以安稳退休了。

sentences.english: Because it gives you that financial security needed to invest your money for retirement.
sentences.chinese: 因为它让你知道，金融安全需要你投资在退休方面。

sentences.english: In the spring of 1946, rumors of Dai Li’s retirement were rife.
sentences.chinese: 1946年春，戴笠即将退休的流言盛流。

sentences.english: This VEBA would pay health care costs for retirees.
sentences.chinese: VEBA将为退休人员支付保健费用。

definition: to retire/to leave work and rest (euphemism for compulsory retirement of old cadres)
to withdraw to the second line of duty/to resign from a leading post (and assume an advisory post)
to come off sentry duty/to lay off (a worker)/laid-off
to resign from office/to dismiss from office
to change one's profession/to transfer to civilian work
to retire/to leave office/to quit a job
to hold an office or post
